title: QC-GIS
text:
Quad Cities GIS User Group
Establishing a GIS User Group in the QC area creates a network of partnerships with local organization, educational institutions and all other GIS users. It provides essential professional involvement in our local community, strengthens existing partnerships, and creates access to a pool of local GIS knowledge and resources.

Meetings
Upcoming meeting info is emailed out to the user list prior to the meeting. Please signup for emails at the bottom of this page. Meetings are held the 2 week of the month at either:

Scott County, EOC, 1100 E 46th St, Davenport, IA 52807. Meeting time noon to 1pm
Augustana College, Hanson Bldg, 3520 Seventh Ave, Rock Island, IL 61201 (Room 234). Meeting time from 1-2pm

title: Knowledge Share
text: QC-GIS is a regional GIS user group for the Quad Cities area. Created to provide all GIS users a forum to network and share their knowledge.

title: Knowledge Share
section: Bring your ideas and experience to the group.
text:
Bring your ideas and experience to the group.
If you are interested in presenting please email Bobby Oliver at the contact link below. Provide your name, organization, topic of talk, what technology is needed for your presentation, and what is the best month, day and time you’re available.

GIS Certifications
Here is the link to the Geographic Information System Certification Institute (GISCI) for those interest in becoming a GISP.   GISCI Link  


Geospatial Communities

The GPN
The Geospatial Professional Network is a vibrant community uniting emerging and experienced GIS professionals through top-tier education, networking, and career development. We are committed to upholding ethical standards, empowering you to support your organization, advance your career, and shape the future of the geospatial profession.  
The GPN Link   


WiGIS
Women in GIS is an inclusive group of women and allies coming together to provide support, resources, and opportunities for success as you navigate your geospatial career.

WiGIS Link   


ASPRS
The American Society for Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing (ASPRS) is a scientific association serving thousands of professional members around the world. Our mission is to advance knowledge and improve understanding of mapping sciences to promote the responsible applications of photogrammetry, remote sensing, geographic information systems (GIS) and supporting technologies.

ASPRS Link
